us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame

Class FrameLine2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.FrameLine2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Line2DBasics, Line2DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<FrameLine2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<FrameLine2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<FrameLine2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<FrameLine2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable, FixedFrameLine2DBasics, FrameChangeable, FrameLine2DBasics, FrameLine2DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder

    public class FrameLine2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements FrameLine2DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<FrameLine2D>
    FrameLine2D is a 2D line expressed in a given reference frame.

    In addition to representing a Line2DBasics, a ReferenceFrame is associated to a FrameLine2D. This allows, for instance, to enforce, at runtime, that operations on lines occur in the same coordinate system. Also, via the method changeFrame(ReferenceFrame), one can easily calculates the value of a point in different reference frames.

    Because a FrameLine2D extends Line2DBasics, it is compatible with methods only requiring Line2DBasics. However, these methods do NOT assert that the operation occur in the proper coordinate system. Use this feature carefully and always prefer using methods requiring FrameLine2D.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FrameLine2D()
      Default constructor that initializes both point and direction to zero and the reference frame to ReferenceFrame.getWorldFrame().

      • changeFrame

        public void changeFrame(ReferenceFrame desiredFrame)
        Transforms this geometry such that the transformation represents the same geometry but from the perspective of another reference frame: desiredFrame.

        Once the geometry is transformed, the reference frame is updated to desiredFrame. In the case, this.referenceFrame == desiredFrame, this method does nothing.

        Specified by:
        changeFrame in interface FrameChangeable
        Parameters:
        desiredFrame - the reference frame in which this geometry is to be expressed.

      • changeFrameAndProjectToXYPlane

        public void changeFrameAndProjectToXYPlane(ReferenceFrame desiredFrame)
        Performs a transformation of the line such that it is expressed in a new frame desireFrame.

        Because the transformation between two reference frames is a 3D transformation, the result of transforming this line 2D can result in a line 3D. This method projects the result of the transformation onto the XY-plane.

        Specified by:
        changeFrameAndProjectToXYPlane in interface FrameLine2DBasics
        Parameters:
        desiredFrame - the reference frame in which the line is to be expressed.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(FrameLine2D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on the point and vector if this line is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon. This method will return false if the two lines are physically the same but either the point or vector of each line is different. For instance, if this.point == other.point and this.direction == - other.direction, the two lines are physically the same but this method returns false.
        Specified by:
        epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<FrameLine2D>
        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines are equal, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(FrameLine2D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two lines are geometrically similar.

        Two lines are considered geometrically equal is they are collinear, pointing toward the same or opposite direction.

        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<FrameLine2D>
        Parameters:
        other - the line to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if this and other are not expressed in the same reference frame.
